intro: Psychotria latistipula, commonly known as the broad-tipped psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria latistipula is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
